intro: Scabiosa rigida, commonly known as rigid scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, pink or white flower clusters. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa rigida is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
